OBS_COMMENT: The data on Samoa only include roads that are managed by the Land Transport Authority , which is the only part of the network with data on paving status. There are also approximately 1,100–1,400 km of road not managed by the Land Transport Authority, though some of this may only be dirt tracks. The total network has been estimated to be in the order of 2,340 km (Transport Sector Plan 2013–2018. Vol. 2. p.4).

STRUCTURE_NAME: Blue Pacific 2050: Technology And Connectivity (Thematic Area 7)
Indicator: Liner Shipping Connectivity Index
DATA_SOURCE: Review of Economic Infrastructure in the Pacific: Pacific Infrastructure Performance Indicators 2021 report
OBS_COMMENT: The figure is from Quarter 3 of the given year. A benchmark of 100 was set in 2004. For each of the five components in the calculation (number of regular containerized ships serviced in the country,their container-carrying capacity,maximum vessel size that can be received,number of services, and number of companies that deploy container ships to a country’s ports), a country’s value is divided by the maximum value of each component in 2004, the five components are then averaged for each country, and the average is divided by the maximum average for 2004 and multiplied by 100.

STRUCTURE_NAME: Blue Pacific 2050: Technology And Connectivity (Thematic Area 7)
Indicator: Liner Shipping Connectivity Index
DATA_SOURCE: Review of Economic Infrastructure in the Pacific: Pacific Infrastructure Performance Indicators 2021 report
OBS_COMMENT: The figure is from Quarter 3 of the given year. A benchmark of 100 was set in 2004. For each of the five components in the calculation (number of regular containerized ships serviced in the country,their container-carrying capacity,maximum vessel size that can be received,number of services, and number of companies that deploy container ships to a country’s ports), a country’s value is divided by the maximum value of each component in 2004, the five components are then averaged for each country, and the average is divided by the maximum average for 2004 and multiplied by 100.

STRUCTURE_NAME: Blue Pacific 2050: Technology And Connectivity (Thematic Area 7)
Indicator: Liner Shipping Connectivity Index
DATA_SOURCE: Review of Economic Infrastructure in the Pacific: Pacific Infrastructure Performance Indicators 2021 report
OBS_COMMENT: The figure is from Quarter 3 of the given year. A benchmark of 100 was set in 2004. For each of the five components in the calculation (number of regular containerized ships serviced in the country,their container-carrying capacity,maximum vessel size that can be received,number of services, and number of companies that deploy container ships to a country’s ports), a country’s value is divided by the maximum value of each component in 2004, the five components are then averaged for each country, and the average is divided by the maximum average for 2004 and multiplied by 100.

STRUCTURE_NAME: Blue Pacific 2050: Technology And Connectivity (Thematic Area 7)
Indicator: Liner Shipping Connectivity Index
DATA_SOURCE: Review of Economic Infrastructure in the Pacific: Pacific Infrastructure Performance Indicators 2021 report
OBS_COMMENT: The figure is from Quarter 3 of the given year. A benchmark of 100 was set in 2004. For each of the five components in the calculation (number of regular containerized ships serviced in the country,their container-carrying capacity,maximum vessel size that can be received,number of services, and number of companies that deploy container ships to a country’s ports), a country’s value is divided by the maximum value of each component in 2004, the five components are then averaged for each country, and the average is divided by the maximum average for 2004 and multiplied by 100.

DATA_SOURCE: Review of Economic Infrastructure in the Pacific: Pacific Infrastructure Performance Indicators 2021 report
OBS_COMMENT: The figure is from Quarter 3 of the given year. A benchmark of 100 was set in 2004. For each of the five components in the calculation (number of regular containerized ships serviced in the country,their container-carrying capacity,maximum vessel size that can be received,number of services, and number of companies that deploy container ships to a country’s ports), a country’s value is divided by the maximum value of each component in 2004, the five components are then averaged for each country, and the average is divided by the maximum average for 2004 and multiplied by 100.

STRUCTURE_NAME: Blue Pacific 2050: Technology And Connectivity (Thematic Area 7)
Indicator: Liner Shipping Connectivity Index
DATA_SOURCE: Review of Economic Infrastructure in the Pacific: Pacific Infrastructure Performance Indicators 2021 report
OBS_COMMENT: The figure is from Quarter 3 of the given year. A benchmark of 100 was set in 2004. For each of the five components in the calculation (number of regular containerized ships serviced in the country,their container-carrying capacity,maximum vessel size that can be received,number of services, and number of companies that deploy container ships to a country’s ports), a country’s value is divided by the maximum value of each component in 2004, the five components are then averaged for each country, and the average is divided by the maximum average for 2004 and multiplied by 100.

STRUCTURE_NAME: Blue Pacific 2050: Technology And Connectivity (Thematic Area 7)
Indicator: Liner Shipping Connectivity Index
DATA_SOURCE: Review of Economic Infrastructure in the Pacific: Pacific Infrastructure Performance Indicators 2021 report
OBS_COMMENT: The figure is from Quarter 3 of the given year. A benchmark of 100 was set in 2004. For each of the five components in the calculation (number of regular containerized ships serviced in the country,their container-carrying capacity,maximum vessel size that can be received,number of services, and number of companies that deploy container ships to a country’s ports), a country’s value is divided by the maximum value of each component in 2004, the five components are then averaged for each country, and the average is divided by the maximum average for 2004 and multiplied by 100.

For each of the five components in the calculation (number of regular containerized ships serviced in the country,their container-carrying capacity,maximum vessel size that can be received,number of services, and number of companies that deploy container ships to a country’s ports), a country’s value is divided by the maximum value of each component in 2004, the five components are then averaged for each country, and the average is divided by the maximum average for 2004 and multiplied by 100.

STRUCTURE_NAME: Blue Pacific 2050: Technology And Connectivity (Thematic Area 7)
Indicator: Liner Shipping Connectivity Index
DATA_SOURCE: Review of Economic Infrastructure in the Pacific: Pacific Infrastructure Performance Indicators 2021 report
OBS_COMMENT: The figure is from Quarter 3 of the given year. A benchmark of 100 was set in 2004. For each of the five components in the calculation (number of regular containerized ships serviced in the country,their container-carrying capacity,maximum vessel size that can be received,number of services, and number of companies that deploy container ships to a country’s ports), a country’s value is divided by the maximum value of each component in 2004, the five components are then averaged for each country, and the average is divided by the maximum average for 2004 and multiplied by 100.

STRUCTURE_NAME: Blue Pacific 2050: Technology And Connectivity (Thematic Area 7)
Indicator: Liner Shipping Connectivity Index
DATA_SOURCE: Review of Economic Infrastructure in the Pacific: Pacific Infrastructure Performance Indicators 2021 report
OBS_COMMENT: The figure is from Quarter 3 of the given year. A benchmark of 100 was set in 2004. For each of the five components in the calculation (number of regular containerized ships serviced in the country,their container-carrying capacity,maximum vessel size that can be received,number of services, and number of companies that deploy container ships to a country’s ports), a country’s value is divided by the maximum value of each component in 2004, the five components are then averaged for each country, and the average is divided by the maximum average for 2004 and multiplied by 100.

STRUCTURE_NAME: Blue Pacific 2050: Technology And Connectivity (Thematic Area 7)
Indicator: Liner Shipping Connectivity Index
DATA_SOURCE: Review of Economic Infrastructure in the Pacific: Pacific Infrastructure Performance Indicators 2021 report
OBS_COMMENT: The figure is from Quarter 3 of the given year. A benchmark of 100 was set in 2004. For each of the five components in the calculation (number of regular containerized ships serviced in the country,their container-carrying capacity,maximum vessel size that can be received,number of services, and number of companies that deploy container ships to a country’s ports), a country’s value is divided by the maximum value of each component in 2004, the five components are then averaged for each country, and the average is divided by the maximum average for 2004 and multiplied by 100.

STRUCTURE_NAME: Blue Pacific 2050: Technology And Connectivity (Thematic Area 7)
Indicator: Liner Shipping Connectivity Index
DATA_SOURCE: Review of Economic Infrastructure in the Pacific: Pacific Infrastructure Performance Indicators 2021 report
OBS_COMMENT: The figure is from Quarter 3 of the given year. A benchmark of 100 was set in 2004. For each of the five components in the calculation (number of regular containerized ships serviced in the country,their container-carrying capacity,maximum vessel size that can be received,number of services, and number of companies that deploy container ships to a country’s ports), a country’s value is divided by the maximum value of each component in 2004, the five components are then averaged for each country, and the average is divided by the maximum average for 2004 and multiplied by 100.

STRUCTURE_NAME: Blue Pacific 2050: Technology And Connectivity (Thematic Area 7)
Indicator: Liner Shipping Connectivity Index
DATA_SOURCE: Review of Economic Infrastructure in the Pacific: Pacific Infrastructure Performance Indicators 2021 report
OBS_COMMENT: The figure is from Quarter 3 of the given year. A benchmark of 100 was set in 2004. For each of the five components in the calculation (number of regular containerized ships serviced in the country,their container-carrying capacity,maximum vessel size that can be received,number of services, and number of companies that deploy container ships to a country’s ports), a country’s value is divided by the maximum value of each component in 2004, the five components are then averaged for each country, and the average is divided by the maximum average for 2004 and multiplied by 100.

DATA_SOURCE: Review of Economic Infrastructure in the Pacific: Pacific Infrastructure Performance Indicators 2021 report
OBS_COMMENT: The figure is from Quarter 3 of the given year. A benchmark of 100 was set in 2004. For each of the five components in the calculation (number of regular containerized ships serviced in the country,their container-carrying capacity,maximum vessel size that can be received,number of services, and number of companies that deploy container ships to a country’s ports), a country’s value is divided by the maximum value of each component in 2004, the five components are then averaged for each country, and the average is divided by the maximum average for 2004 and multiplied by 100.
